page.title: 01General notes on our Block
page.content: Our block of land stretches from the moors in the west to beyond Hoddlesden in the east,& from the moors in the south, to beyond Darwen town centre in the north.Near the town centre is India Mill with its ornamental chimney Darwen's best known landmark.It was the first mill in Britain to spin nothing but artificial fibres.The process of printing wallpaper on rolls was invented in Darwen.There are still wallpaper factories in town and an old printing machine by the side of the main road.Darwen used to be a weaving town,with 70 mills. Few are left,& even fewer are still in use.Now there are more modern industries,e.g.I.C.I. Perspex is made in the town.
